Expires: 22 February 2023
BGP Cease Notification Subcode For BFD A BGP Cease Notification Subcode For Bidirectional Forwarding Detection
draft-ietf-idr-bfd-subcode-03 (BFD)
draft-ietf-idr-bfd-subcode-04
Abstract Abstract
The Bidirectional Forwarding Detection protocol (BFD) is used to The Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) protocol is used to
detect loss of connectivity between two forwarding engines, typically detect loss of connectivity between two forwarding engines, typically
with low latency. BFD is leveraged by routing protocols, including with low latency. BFD is leveraged by routing protocols, including
the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP), to use that detection of loss of the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP), to bring down routing protocol
connectivity to bring down the protocol connections faster than the connections faster than the native protocol timers.
native protocol timers.
This document defines a Subcode for the BGP Cease NOTIFICATION This document defines a Subcode for the BGP Cease NOTIFICATION
message for when a BGP connection is being closed due to a BFD message for when a BGP connection is being closed due to a BFD
session going down. session going down.

"SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this
document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 [RFC2119] document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 [RFC2119]

1. Introduction 1. Introduction
The Bidirectional Forwarding Detection protocol (BFD) [RFC5880] is The Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) protocol [RFC5880] is
used to detect loss of connectivity between two forwarding engines, used to detect loss of connectivity between two forwarding engines,
typically with low latency. BFD is utilized as a service for various typically with low latency. BFD is utilized as a service for various
clients, including routing protocols, to provide an advisory clients, including routing protocols, to provide an advisory
mechanism for those clients to take action when a BFD session goes mechanism for those clients to take appropriate actions when a BFD
down [RFC5882]. This is typically used by the clients to take faster session goes down [RFC5882]. This is typically used by the clients
action in terminating their connections than the native protocol to quickly trigger closure of their connections than the native
timers might allow. protocol timers might allow.
The Border Gateway Protocol, Version 4 (BGP) [RFC4271] terminates its The Border Gateway Protocol, Version 4 (BGP) [RFC4271] terminates its
sessions upon Hold Timer expiration when the speaker does not receive connections upon Hold Timer expiration when the speaker does not
a BGP message within the negotiated Hold Time interval. The minimum receive a BGP message within the negotiated Hold Time interval. As
Hold Time interval supported by the protocol is three seconds. The per Section 4.2 of [RFC4271], the minimum Hold Time interval
Hold Timer may be optionally negotiated to being disabled with a Hold supported by the protocol must be either zero, or at least three
Time interval of zero. seconds.
If a BGP speaker desires to have its sessions terminate faster than If a BGP speaker desires to have its connections terminate faster
the supported BGP Hold Timer can accommodate upon loss of than the negotiated BGP Hold Timer can accommodate upon loss of
connectivity, BFD is used to supply that faster detection. When the connectivity with a neighbor, the BGP speakers can rely upon BFD is
BFD session state changes to Down, the BGP speaker terminates the used to supply that faster detection. When the BFD session state
session. BGP will send a NOTIFICATION message, if possible, and then changes to Down, the BGP speaker terminates the connection with a
close the TCP connection for the session. NOTIFICATION message sent to the neighbor, if possible, and then
close the TCP connection for the connection.
2. BFD Cease NOTIFICATION Subcode 2. BFD Cease NOTIFICATION Subcode
The value 10 has been allocated by IANA for the "BFD Down" Cease The value 10 has been allocated by IANA for the "BFD Down" Cease
NOTIFICATION message Subcode. NOTIFICATION message Subcode.
When a BGP session is terminated due to a BFD session going into the When a BGP connection is terminated due to a BFD session going into
Down state, the BGP Speaker SHOULD send a NOTIFICATION message with the Down state, the BGP speaker SHOULD send a NOTIFICATION message
the Error Code Cease and the Error Subcode "BFD Down". with the Error Code Cease and the Error Subcode "BFD Down".
3. Operational Considerations 3. Operational Considerations
A BFD session may go Down when there is only a partial loss of A BFD session may go Down when there is only a partial loss of
connectivity between two BGP Speakers. Operators using BFD for their connectivity between two BGP speakers. Operators using BFD for their
BGP sessions make choices for what BFD timers are used based on a BGP connections make choices for what BFD timers are used based upon
variety of inputs for stability vs. fast failure depending on the a variety of criteria; for example, stability vs. fast failure.
role BGP is playing for the deployment.
In the event of a BGP session being terminated due to a BFD Down In the event of a BGP connection being terminated due to a BFD Down
event from partial loss of connectivity as detected by BFD, the event from partial loss of connectivity as detected by BFD, the
remote BGP Speaker might be able to receive the BGP NOTIFICATION remote BGP speaker might be able to receive a BGP Cease NOTIFICATION
message with the BFD Down Subcode. The receiving BGP Speaker will message with the BFD Down Subcode. The receiving BGP speaker will
then have an understanding that the session is being terminated then have an understanding that the connection is being terminated
because of a BFD-detected issue and not an issue with the BGP because of a BFD-detected issue and not an issue with the BGP
speaker. speaker.
When there is a total loss of connectivity between two BGP Speakers, When there is a total loss of connectivity between two BGP speakers,
it may not be possible for the NOTIFICATION message to have been it may not be possible for the Cease NOTIFICATION message to have
sent. Even so, BGP speakers SHOULD provide this reason as part of been sent. Even so, BGP speakers SHOULD provide this reason as part
their operational state; e.g. bgpPeerLastError in the BGP MIB. of their operational state. Examples include bgpPeerLastError in the
[RFC4273]. BGP MIB [RFC4273], and "last-error" in [I-D.ietf-idr-bgp-model].
When the procedures in [RFC8538] for sending a NOTIFICATION message When the procedures in [RFC8538] for sending a NOTIFICATION message
with a Cease Code and Hard Reset Subcode, and the session is being with a Cease Code and Hard Reset Subcode, and the BGP connection is
terminated because BFD has gone Down, the BFD Down Subcode SHOULD be being terminated because BFD has gone Down, the BFD Down Subcode
encapsulated in the Hard Reset's data portion of the NOTIFICATION SHOULD be encapsulated in the Hard Reset's data portion of the
message. NOTIFICATION message.
4. Security Considerations 4. Security Considerations
This document introduces no additional BGP security considerations. This document introduces no additional BGP security considerations.

of this document. of this document.
